### Apps

[Atom Text Editor](https://atom.io)
:   A hackable, cross-platform, open-source text editor by GitHub.

[FFmpeg](https://ffmpeg.org/)
:   A complete, cross-platform solution to record, convert and stream audio and video.

    (*for Mac users: download the zip, unzip, and copy ffmpeg to /usr/local/share*)

[GIMP](https://www.gimp.org/)
:   The GNU Image Manipulation Program is a free and open-source cross-platform raster graphics editor.

[Git for Windows](https://github.com/git-for-windows/git/releases)
:   A lightweight, native set of tools that brings the full feature set of the Git SCM to Windows while providing appropriate user interfaces for experienced Git users and novices alike.

[ImageMagick](https://imagemagick.org/)
:   A free cross-platform software to create, edit, compose, or convert bitmap images.

[OSGeo4W](https://trac.osgeo.org/osgeo4w/)
:   A binary distribution of a broad set of open-source geospatial software (e.g., QGIS, GDAL/OGR, GRASS) for Windows environments.

    (*note: you can get Python3 w/ packages, netcdf, hdf5, and ffmpeg using OSGeo4W*)

[Pandoc](https://pandoc.org/)
:   A universal document converter.

[Panoply](https://www.giss.nasa.gov/tools/panoply/)
:   A cross-platform application that plots geo-referenced and other arrays from netCDF, HDF, and other datasets.

[QGIS 3](https://www.qgis.org/en/site/)
:   A free and open-source geographic information system.


### Programming Languages

[Python 3](https://www.python.org/)
:   A programming language that lets you work quickly and integrate systems more effectively.

[R](https://cran.r-project.org/)
:   A freely available language and environment for statistical computing and graphics.


### Python Packages

[exifread](https://github.com/ianare/exif-py)
:   Python package for reading exchangeable image file format (EXIF) metadata.[^exif19]

[gpsphoto](https://pypi.org/project/gpsphoto/)
:   Return, modify, or remove GPS data from JPEG or TIFF Exif data.[^jessgwiii]
    Requires ExifRead, piexif, and PIL.

[h5py](https://www.h5py.org/)
:   Python package for reading and writing in the HDF5 binary data format.

[Pillow](https://pillow.readthedocs.io/en/stable/index.html)
:   A friendly PIL (Python Imaging Library) fork by [Alex Clark and Contributors](https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/graphs/contributors).

[pyhdf](https://www.hdfeos.org/software/pyhdf.php)
:   Python package for reading HDF4 (HDF-EOS) files.

[scipy.io.netcdf](https://docs.scipy.org/doc/scipy-0.16.1/reference/io.html#module-scipy.io.netcdf)
:   Provides modules, classes, and functions to read data from and write data to the classic NetCDF file format.

[Unofficial Windows Binaries for Python Extension Packages](https://www.lfd.uci.edu/~gohlke/pythonlibs/)
:   Provides 32- and 64-bit Windows (unofficial) binaries of many scientific open-source extension packages for the official CPython distribution of the Python programming language. A few binaries are available for the PyPy distribution.[^gohlke19]

[^gohlke19]: Christoph Gohlke, Laboratory for Fluorescence Dynamics, University of California, Irvine.
